definitions: occurring continuously without stopping or interruption over time
examples: The ceaseless rain flooded the entire valley
Their ceaseless efforts finally paid off handsomely

definitions: widely known and praised for achievements or excellence
examples: The celebrated author received another prestigious award
We visited the celebrated vineyards of Bordeaux

definitions: expressing joy or marking a special happy occasion
examples: They raised celebratory glasses when the deal closed
The celebratory atmosphere lasted through the night

definitions: positioned in or relating to the sky or outer space
supremely good or beautiful, suggesting heaven or divine realms
examples: Astronomers track celestial bodies through powerful telescopes
The celestial navigation guided ancient sailors homeward
Her celestial voice mesmerized the entire audience
The sunset created a celestial display of colors

definitions: not having sexual relations, especially by religious vow or choice
examples: The celibate monks lived in the mountain monastery
She remained celibate throughout her entire adult life

definitions: relating to or consisting of biological cells
having a structure of small compartments or units
examples: Scientists studied cellular division under powerful microscopes
The cellular structure revealed damaged tissue patterns
The cellular blanket kept the baby warm
They installed cellular concrete for better insulation

definitions: having objectionable parts removed or suppressed by authority
examples: The censored version removed all violent scenes
Censored documents revealed little useful information

definitions: relating to a period of one hundred years or its celebration
examples: The centenary celebration attracted thousands of alumni
They published a centenary edition of his works

definitions: relating to a hundredth anniversary or lasting one hundred years
examples: The centennial exhibition showcased the city's history
They planted centennial trees throughout the park

definitions: positioned at or near the middle point of something
examples: The center lane remained closed for construction work
Place the center piece carefully on the table

definitions: emotionally stable and self-aware with inner balance
placed at or focused on the middle point
examples: She remained centered despite the chaos around her
His centered approach helped resolve the conflict
The centered text looked professional on the page
Keep the image centered in the frame

definitions: of primary importance or fundamental significance to something
located at or near the center or middle position
examples: Trust remains central to their business philosophy
The central argument convinced the entire jury
The central location made commuting easy for everyone
They met in the central plaza every Sunday

definitions: brought under the control of a central authority or location
examples: The centralised system improved efficiency across departments
Their centralised database stored all customer information

definitions: brought under the control of a central authority or location
examples: The centralized management structure streamlined all decisions
A centralized heating system warmed the entire building

definitions: tending to concentrate power or control in a central authority
examples: The centralizing policies reduced regional autonomy significantly
Their centralizing tendency worried the local leaders

definitions: positioned at or near the middle point of something
examples: The centre court hosted the championship match
Keep the centre aisle clear for emergencies

definitions: having a specified thing as the central focus or emphasis
examples: Their customer-centric approach increased satisfaction ratings significantly
The design remained user-centric throughout development phases

definitions: moving or tending to move away from a center point
examples: Centrifugal force pushed riders against the wall
The centrifugal pump moved water through the system

definitions: having moderate political views between left and right extremes
examples: The centrist candidate appealed to both parties
Their centrist policies attracted broad voter support

definitions: made from clay hardened by heat in a kiln
examples: The ceramic tiles resisted water damage perfectly
She collected ceramic bowls from around the world

definitions: relating to edible grains or food made from them
examples: Cereal crops covered thousands of acres of farmland
The cereal aisle offered dozens of breakfast options

definitions: requiring serious intellectual effort and sophisticated thinking
relating to the cerebrum or brain
examples: His cerebral approach solved complex theoretical problems
The cerebral film challenged viewers' assumptions completely
The cerebral cortex controls higher thought processes
Cerebral damage affected her motor skills significantly

definitions: relating to or used for formal religious or public ceremonies
examples: The ceremonial robes dated back three centuries
They performed ceremonial duties at state functions

definitions: having complete confidence or no doubt about something
particular but not explicitly named or stated
examples: She felt certain the answer was correct
I'm certain we've met somewhere before
Certain people always arrive late to meetings
The policy applies only to certain situations

definitions: having received an official certificate of qualification or competence
examples: Only certificated teachers could apply for the position
The certificated pilot had thousands of flight hours

definitions: officially recognized as meeting required standards or qualifications
examples: The certified accountant reviewed all financial statements
We only use certified organic ingredients here

definitions: having a deep blue color like a clear sky
examples: The cerulean waters sparkled in the Mediterranean sun
She painted the ceiling a cerulean shade

definitions: physically restrained or secured with metal chains
connected together in a series or sequence
examples: The chained prisoner couldn't escape the dungeon
They found the chained bicycle still intact
The chained reactions proceeded through multiple stages
Use chained commands to automate the process

definitions: having a soft, powdery texture similar to chalk
having a pale white color resembling chalk
examples: The chalky soil made gardening particularly challenging
The medicine left a chalky taste in her mouth
His chalky complexion suggested he needed fresh air
The walls had a chalky white finish

definitions: requiring considerable physical or mental effort to accomplish successfully
openly questioning or disputing something, especially authority
examples: The challenging puzzle took hours to complete
Teaching teenagers can be particularly challenging work
Her challenging gaze made him reconsider his position
The lawyer's challenging tone unsettled the witness

definitions: divided into or having separate chambers or compartments
examples: The chambered nautilus shell displayed perfect symmetry
They discovered a chambered tomb beneath the pyramid

definitions: of the highest quality or most outstanding in a category
examples: The farm produced champion livestock every year
Her champion roses won first prize again

definitions: occurring or discovered by accident rather than design or expectation
examples: A chance meeting changed both their lives forever
The chance discovery led to major scientific breakthrough

definitions: able to change or likely to change frequently and unpredictably
examples: The changeable weather required multiple clothing options
Her changeable moods made relationships difficult

definitions: having undergone alteration or transformation from a previous state
examples: The changed circumstances required new strategies immediately
He seemed like a changed person after therapy

definitions: in the process of becoming different or undergoing transformation
examples: The changing seasons brought different colors to trees
Adapt to changing market conditions or fail

definitions: spoken or sung in a rhythmic, repetitive manner
examples: The chanted prayers echoed through the ancient temple
Their chanted slogans filled the protest march

definitions: in a state of complete confusion and disorder
examples: The chaotic scene made rescue efforts nearly impossible
Her chaotic lifestyle eventually caught up with her

definitions: typical of a particular person, place, or thing's nature
examples: His characteristic humor lightened even serious meetings
The wine had the characteristic taste of the region

definitions: having a dark gray color like burnt wood
examples: He wore a charcoal suit to the interview
The charcoal sky threatened an approaching storm

definitions: subject to being charged a fee or payment
liable to be formally accused of a crime
examples: All chargeable services are listed in the contract
Extra baggage is chargeable on this flight
The offense is chargeable under federal law
His actions were chargeable as criminal negligence

definitions: carrying or filled with electrical energy
filled with intense emotion or tension
formally accused of a crime or wrongdoing
examples: The charged particles moved through the magnetic field
Keep charged batteries away from metal objects
The charged atmosphere made everyone uncomfortable
Their charged exchange revealed deep underlying tensions
The charged suspect appeared before the judge
Three charged individuals await trial next month

definitions: having a compelling charm that inspires devotion in others
examples: The charismatic leader inspired thousands of followers
Her charismatic personality made her naturally popular

definitions: showing kindness and sympathy, especially in judging others
relating to the assistance of those in need
examples: Her charitable interpretation gave him the benefit of doubt
Take a more charitable view of his mistakes
The charitable foundation raised millions for education
All charitable donations are tax deductible

definitions: feeling delighted or pleased by something
seemingly protected by magic or extraordinary good luck
examples: She seemed charmed by his old-fashioned manners
The charmed audience applauded enthusiastically
He lived a charmed life, avoiding every danger
Their charmed existence continued despite economic downturns

definitions: pleasant and attractive in a way that pleases others
examples: The charming cottage overlooked the peaceful valley
His charming manner won everyone's trust immediately

definitions: officially licensed or authorized by a charter or formal document
examples: Only chartered accountants could audit public companies
The chartered bus arrived exactly on time

definitions: having a vivid yellow-green color
examples: The chartreuse dress stood out at the party
She painted the accent wall chartreuse

definitions: abstaining from sexual activity or maintaining sexual purity
simple and unadorned in style or design
examples: She remained chaste until her wedding day
The chaste kiss barely touched her cheek
The chaste design emphasized function over decoration
Her chaste writing style avoided all embellishment

definitions: fond of talking in a friendly, informal way
examples: The chatty neighbor shared all the local gossip
Her chatty emails brightened everyone's Monday mornings
